node.title: Woman Allegedly Assaulted by 12- and 13-Year-Old After Bumping Into Them on Train
node.description: During an argument, a pair of adolescents allegedly struck a 27-year-old woman in the face, causing her to receive a cut on her lip and her glasses to break.

node.title: Josh Duggar's Previous Confession to Molesting 4 Girls Can Be Used in Trial, Judge Says
node.description: "The child pornography victims in this case are approximately the same ages as the victims of defendant's hands-on child-molestation offenses," said the order.

node.title: Teacher Allegedly Left Handwritten Notes at School Threatening Violence: Police
node.description: Police said Wednesday the teacher admitted to writing the notes but "had no intentions or means" of carrying out the threats included within them.

node.title: Right to repair laws may change after Productivity Commission recommendations
node.description: Many of the everyday items we own have become more technologically advanced in recent years, from phones to tractors, but our ability to repair them has become harder. That could be about to change.

node.title: A spoiler-free guide to Dune — the movie adaption of a book described as unfilmable
node.description: After a year-long delay due to the pandemic, the movie adaption of Frank Herbert's beloved 1965 novel Dune has finally arrived in Australian cinemas.

node.title: Michigan teen faces first-degree murder charges after school shootings
node.description: A 15-year-old boy is charged with murder and terrorism for firing shots that left four fellow students dead and seven others injured at a Michigan high school, authorities say.

node.title: Supemarket dollar milk war is now just a memory as prices steadily rise
node.description: The cost of cheap supermarket milk has now hit $1.30 per litre after Woolworths, Coles, and Aldi lifted prices last week.

node.title: SA Governor isolating after being identified as close contact of COVID-19 case
node.description: South Australia's Governor is in isolation and the state's Opposition Leader and his deputy return negative COVID-19 tests, after all being identified as close contacts of a COVID-19 case.

node.title: Here's what you need to know about a possible MLB lockout
node.description: Professional baseball players want higher pay and to stop teams from "tanking" during the season.

node.title: ‘A Sherlock Carol’ Review: Crime-Solving on Christmas Eve
node.description: Mark Shanahan remixes Arthur Conan Doyle and Charles Dickens into a clever, crowd-pleasing holiday comedy that happens also to be a murder mystery.

node.title: The End of Roe Is Coming, and It Is Coming Soon
node.description: I thought we had more time before the 1973 decision was overturned. I now believe  I was wrong.

node.title: Square, Jack Dorsey’s payments company, changes its name to Block.
node.description: Mr. Dorsey has in recent years grown more fascinated by cryptocurrencies and the promise of technological decentralization that blockchain technology could allow for.

node.title: Biden Projects Normalcy and Optimism as Omicron Poses New Threat
node.description: The president tried to convey holiday cheer as he celebrated Hanukkah and downplayed virus concerns as the variant was detected in California.

node.title: Marcus Lamb, a Christian Broadcaster and Vaccine Skeptic, Dies of Covid
node.description: Mr. Lamb, who co-founded the Daystar Television Network, repeatedly suggested on air that people pray instead of getting vaccinated.

node.title: Peter DeFazio, House Transportation Committee Chairman, Will Retire
node.description: The Oregon Democrat, who has served for nearly 35 years, is the third House committee leader to announce his retirement this year, as the party braces for a grueling midterm election.

node.title: ‘So Many Dimensions’: A Drought Study Underlines the Complexity of Climate
node.description: Low rainfall has caused a humanitarian crisis in Madagascar, but common assumptions about drought didn’t hold up to scrutiny.

node.title: Man's Viral Video About 'How to Spot a Good Baguette' Divides Internet
node.description: "[O]ne of the most obvious ways to spot a good baguette is to look for a flat back vs. a dotted back," the TikToker said.

node.title: South Africa Reports New COVID Cases Have Doubled, Braces for Rapid Rise Amid Omicron
node.description: While it is not yet known if the Omicron variant is responsible for South Africa's surge, some experts say that it is very possible.

node.title: NTSB Tells Subway, Rail Systems Nationwide to Inspect for Wheel Defects After Derailment
node.description: A preliminary report about an October 12 train derailment in Washington, D.C., attributed the incident to a flaw "not easily identifiable" in visual checks.

node.title: Māori agribusiness crop trials hold hopes for local employment
node.description: The project which started in 2019 involves the owners of 25 Māori land blocks which cover 18,000 hectares of land, with about a third suitable for livestock, horticulture or arable farming.

node.title: Nearly 100 fewer firefighters on job due to Covid-19 vaccination mandate
node.description: Fire and Emergency has backtracked after mistakenly trying to block staff who do not show a vaccine pass from doing or providing training.

node.title: Louis Vuitton Show at Art Basel Becomes a Virgil Abloh Tribute
node.description: The front row included Kanye West, Kim Kardashian, Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump.

node.title: California officials say they expected the Omicron variant, and they’re ready.
node.description: The first case of the variant detected in the United States was in a San Francisco resident who traveled back from South Africa.

node.title: DOJ Says It's Investigating 10-Year-Old's Suicide After Bullying Allegations at Her School
node.description: Isabella "Izzy" Tichenor was allegedly bullied at school. Her mother alleges the teacher and district were informed and did nothing about the situation before Izzy took her own life.

node.title: Savea and Elder headline list of NZ rugby awards nominees
node.description: Ardie Savea is up against Will Jordan, Jordie Barrett and Rieko Ioane for the All Blacks player of the year award.

node.title: MIQ health and safety reps left waiting 11 months for training, union says
node.description: An MIQ hotel health and safety representative says problems with escapees are not being addressed because the system neglects workers.

node.title: Alec Baldwin says he "didn't pull the trigger" in fatal "Rust" shooting
node.description: The actor said the shooting was the worst thing that has ever happened to him.

node.title: Woman Who Sued Walmart Over Shoplifting Arrest Is Awarded $2.1 Million
node.description: Lesleigh Nurse said she was wrongfully accused of stealing groceries from the Walmart in Semmes, Ala., in 2016. The retailer said it would appeal the verdict.

node.title: An Israeli doctor caught Omicron, then met dozens of people. Just one contact has tested positive.
node.description: In the days leading up to his positive test, Elad Maor interacted with about 100 people. So far, only one contact has tested positive.

node.title: Tesla Files Legal Papers to Officially Move Headquarters to Austin, Texas
node.description: The auto company owned by Elon Musk was previously headquartered in Palo Alto, California.
